item.title: Kingdom Hearts Fan Makes Incredible 10 Cent Discovery at Their Library
item.description:
A fan recently purchased a BradyGames Limited Edition Guide for Kingdom Hearts 2 for only ten cents. This Kingdom Hearts 2 fan’s story is a great example of how it’s still possible to obtain amazing gaming-related merchandise for excellent prices with the right amount of luck.

The Kingdom Hearts series started in 2002 with a unique premise: mixing famous Disney characters like Mickey Mouse and Donald Duck with Square’s most popular ones, such as those from the Final Fantasy series. Initially focused on the protagonist Sora and his journey with Donald and Goofy, Kingdom Hearts had multiple mainline titles and spin-offs, with Kingdom Hearts 2 being one of the most beloved games in the franchise.

Fan Purchases Kingdom Hearts 2's Limited Edition Guide for Only 10 Cents

A Kingdom Hearts fan called FF9FTW recently shared an amazing story: they were able to purchase a BradyGames Limited Edition Guide for Kingdom Hearts 2 for only 10 cents at their local library. The gamer showcased a few pictures of the guidebook, claiming it was in “fantastic condition.” BradyGames released guides for many popular games during the 90s and early 2000s, such as Chrono Cross , Banjo-Kazooie , Devil May Cry , and others, but essentially all of them are collector’s pieces by now, and can be fairly hard to find at normal prices. In the post’s comments, gamers were pretty impressed with FF9FTW’s discovery. Kingdom Hearts 2 is a very popular PlayStation 2 game, so many gamers purchased the guide back in the day and had fond memories of it.

FF9FTW is not the only gamer to share an amazing discovery recently. A few weeks ago, for example, one fan purchased a special Pokemon TCG card for only $1 from a local secondhand store. Named “FILE NO.000,” the card could reach a value of up to $4,408 if graded and sold online, which made the fan incredibly lucky.

Despite Kingdom Hearts being a fairly big franchise, not many games based on it have been coming out recently, with 2019’s Kingdom Hearts 3 being the last mainline title to come out, followed by the rhythm-based spin-off Melody of Memory in 2020. Kingdom Hearts 4 was announced back in 2022, but it still does not have a release date. However, a few days ago, the possible worlds of Kingdom Hearts 4 were leaked, as one individual allegedly discovered that the game will have worlds inspired by franchises such as Wreck-It Ralph , Zootopia , The Incredibles , Brave , Inside Out , Coco , Wall-E , Star Wars , and more. Obviously, this is unconfirmed information, so fans can only speculate while they wait for the release.

item.title: Lost Soul Aside Takes the Wrong Page From Horizon’s Script
item.description:
Ultizero Games' Lost Soul Aside showed a lot of promise ahead of its launch, and in some ways, it delivered on that promise. Unfortunately, in many other ways, it has failed to live up to the hype that carried it toward its launch, with significant performance issues, repetitive gameplay, underwhelming English voice acting, and more. While the developer has committed to putting some oil on Lost Soul Aside 's performance issues, there is little that can be done about the game's other points of criticism, which boil down to the heart and soul of its story and gameplay.

One thing that is really difficult to ignore about Lost Soul Aside is its dialogue, especially if the game is played with English voice acting turned on. This is largely because the bulk of its dialogue is incredibly cheesy, and even though it's cheesy to the point of almost being endearing, it has a way of taking large chunks out of the game's immersion and what is supposed to be a very serious world-threatening problem. While Lost Soul Aside 's dialogue in general is craggy, though, a lot of those rough edges are the result of something that even Guerrilla Games' Horizon series has been guilty of: overexplaining pretty much everything.

Lost Soul Aside Talks as Much as Horizon's Aloy

Horizon's Aloy Is Known for Overexplaining Things

While it's not necessarily a universal criticism, one thing that many players have noted about Horizon 's Aloy is how much she overexplains things. Even when she's not with anyone, players can hear her making comments about what she's doing, where she's going, and what's happening in the story. On the one hand, that kind of self-dialogue is okay, as it serves as a window into the character's mind when there's no one else around for her to talk to. However, it's when she begins basically guiding players through exploration, puzzles, and combat scenarios that tends to take the joy of discovery out of it all.

This is ultimately where Aloy's tendency to overexplain things gets in the way. Players who prefer not to have their hand held through everything they're doing might want Aloy to just stop talking for a bit so they can have a chance to figure things out on their own. This is where the criticism about Horizon 's Aloy talking too much is actually pretty divisive, though, as some not only see it as the game's way of communicating her thoughts, but also as a way to gently nudge players in the right direction without spelling things out with a clear objective marker or path to follow.

Lost Soul Aside Talks so Much It Interrupts Itself

Lost Soul Aside , on the other hand, isn't even modest enough to be divisive. From the beginning of the game, Lost Soul Aside 's Kaser shows himself to be an expert at all puzzles, even when those puzzles aren't really challenging enough to be referred to as such. He frequently chimes in with solutions that are almost too helpful in light of how simple each problem is. It's the same issue Horizon 's Aloy has run into, though one could say Kaser is on an entirely different level.

It's not just Kaser either, as the game talks so much that it often interrupts itself. Rarely does Lost Soul Aside 's story take a beat between moments just to let characters breathe for a bit, and conversations between characters frequently play out like an episode of Gilmore Girls , where each character seems to know what the other is going to say before they even say it, resulting in a pre-emptively reply. Apart from conversations, Lost Soul Aside 's characters spend too much time explaining things that can be clearly seen, and even if they can't, it might have been better if they were left to assumptions.

To be fair, overexplanation has been a characteristic of Chinese/Japanese role-playing games since their inception, but Lost Soul Aside feels like it took what was once just a habit and made it an intentional practice. Fortunately, this intentionality has almost made Lost Soul Aside unintentionally funny, but that depends on perspective.

item.title: How to Find a Use for the Shark Fin in Path of Exile 2 (Tribal Medicine)
item.description:
Tribal Medicine is a side quest in Path of Exile 2 that asks players to “Find a Use for the Shark Fin,” after they obtain the item at one of the islands in Act 4. The game offers no hints as to the exact purpose of the item, who needs it, and what to do with it, leaving players floundering in search of answers.

What’s even more troublesome is that the Shark Fin takes up a lot of inventory space, which makes carrying loot back and forth between maps more tedious than it needs to be. Luckily, it is very easy to complete Tribal Medicine if you know where to look. Here’s the breakdown.

How to Find a Use for the Shark Fin in Path of Exile 2

Tribal Medicine Quest Guide

The Shark Fin can be delivered to an NPC named Kaimana in Kingsmarch in Act 4 of Path of Exile 2 . Kaimana is a tribal healer stationed on the Karui ship docked directly opposite Makoru’s ship.

Cross the pier and you’ll see the Karui ship on the southern side, with Kaimana standing near its main mast, behind Tavakai (pictured above).

Upon giving Kaimana the Shark Fin, she will offer players three possible rewards.

  1. Level 11 Uncut Skill Gem
  2. Level 11 Uncut Spirit Gem
  3. Level 4 Uncut Support Gem

Choose one of the rewards to complete the Tribal Medicine quest.

Kaimana Missing From Kingsmarch

The Karui ship and Kaimana are not always stationed in Kingsmarch, making it impossible to complete Tribal Medicine. If this happens, it means Kaimana has moved to Ngakanu Island temporarily . Progress through the main story of PoE 2 in Act 4 to unlock and clear Ngakanu Island to have Kaimana return to Kingsmarch, allowing players to turn in the Shark Fin to complete the quest.

How to Get the Shark Fin in Path of Exile 2

Shark Fin Location

The Shark Fin is a guaranteed drop for defeating the “Great White One” shark boss on Whakapanu Island in Path of Exile 2 . The great white shark can be found at the edges of the map, in a large sandy arena called the Shark Pit near the ocean, where it emerges when players approach.

item.title: NBA 2K26: Best Teams for Small Forwards in MyCareer
item.description:
In NBA 2K26 MyCareer, the draft can be based on how well MP performs in Europe and his overall rating. However, by working out with teams in the lead-up to the draft, or by selecting certain dialogue options, players may be able to choose which team they play for , or at the very least increase their chance of being drafted by them.

If players have elected to go with a Small Forward for this year's iteration of MyCareer, they will want to know which are lacking in the position. This will allow MP to get more game time and possibly become a starter. The best teams for Small Forwards for MyCareer in NBA 2K26 might also be lacking depth in the Shooting Guard and Power Forward positions, where Small Forwards might sometimes slot in. Ideally, the overall team wouldn't be too bad either, with strong Point Guards and Centers being ideal to work with.

These rosters and opportunities can change due to trades and free agent signings if players start their MyCareer journey closer to the start of the real NBA 2025-26 season, with squads being updated.

Milwaukee Bucks

Become A Secondary Star Alongside Giannis

Small Forward

Age

Overall

K. Kuzma

30

77

A.J. Green

25

74

A. Coffey

28

73

  • Link up players: Giannis Antetokounmpo

The Milwaukee Bucks have regressed in recent seasons, and with Damian Lillard heading back to Portland, the Greek Freak needs some help. For those who play as Small Forward in MyCareer, only Kyle Kuzma at 77 rated lies between MP and a starting spot. The Bucks are also a great team for Point Guards to join in 2K26 ​​​, due to a deficit in the position.

Chicago Bulls

An Easy Starting Spot For Small Forwards

  • Link up players: Coby White & Josh Giddey

If players want to start as a Small Forward in NBA 2K26 , the Chicago Bulls have an opening in their roster. Ayo Dosunmu is their highest-rated option at just 76 overall, a rating that many will surpass before the draft by using VC to level MP up. The Bulls also have a young roster to ascend with, and who wouldn't want to be the one to restore the storied franchise to glory?

Los Angeles Clippers

Kawhi Will Likely Play At The 3, But Clippers Have No True SFs

Small Forward

Age

Overall

T. Flowers

20

K. Sanders

20

  • Link up players: James Harden, Kawhi Leonard, Ivaca Zubac

The Los Angeles Clippers have a veteran roster full of talent, some of which will need replacing in a season or two. Additionally, the Clippers only have two true Small Forwards, who are both young and not even 70-rated. This allows MP to become a backup for star Kawhi Leonard, who will likely start at the 3. As Kawhi is injury-prone and sometimes might start as a Power Forward, there could even be games for MP to start in the first season.

Memphis Grizzlies

Slot Into An Exciting Young Team Whose Best SF Is 76 Rated

  • Link up players: Ja Morant & Jaren Jackson Jr.

The Memphis Grizzlies have the potential to become a great team with the help of MP in the Small Forward position. With Ja Morant running the show and both Jaren Jackson Jr. and Zach Edey providing the muscle, a Small Forward with the ability to shoot from deep could help Memphis achieve deep runs in the stacked Western Conference playoffs. Ja Morant and MP at the 3 sounds like a juicy combo with alley-oop potential both ways.

Be Part Of A Young & Exciting Team

While Brandon Miller is listed as a Shooting Guard in 2K26 , he can play at the 3, but will likely be the only competition for MP as a Small Forward. Players will also have the chance to grow alongside other young stars, and in a few seasons, the Charlotte Hornets could be a real threat. LaMelo Ball is the main man, but eyes should also be on one of NBA 2K26's rookies, Kon Knueppel, who has an A- potential.

The opportunity to play alongside Nikola Jokic is enough to make anyone want to join the Denver Nuggets, especially with his ability to dish out flashy passes from any angle. The Nuggets also have no true Small Forward, although Cameron Johnson and either of the two best Shooting Guards can play at the 3. While some weeks might be tough for gametime, there are avenues to the starting lineup, especially as few Denver players are young.

After Kevin Durant's switch to the Houston Rockets, the Phoenix Suns are now one of the best teams for Small Forwards in MyCareer for the 2025/26 season. Players can link up with Devin Booker in what should be his prime years and try to take the Suns back to the highs they enjoyed in 2021. With Dillon Brooks only being 79 rated, his starting spot at the 3 is there for the taking. The Suns are also a good option for Centers in MyCareer.

With the addition of Jimmy Butler, the Golden State Warriors can compete once again, although they could do with a little help from MP at Small Forward. They are lacking in the position, meaning MP could find a way onto the starting lineup and receive passes from Curry, or find him for 3s. While the team is led by a veteran core, there are other young players waiting in the ranks to grow alongside MP.

item.title: Borderlands 4's First DLC Vault Hunter is Already Clear
item.description:
Borderlands 4 's launch is just around the corner. The fourth major installment in Gearbox Software's storied looter-shooter series will be arriving September 12, and the buzz around the upcoming entry has been largely positive. The studio has been hard at work updating fans and drip-feeding reveals regarding how Borderlands 4 will be aiming to course correct from some of the missteps that BL3 is acknowledged to have taken. Along with this, the new batch of Vault Hunters have been shown off in more detail, giving players a good idea of their personalities and playstyles.

As the countdown to release ticks closer, fans are also already looking forward to the post-launch support and additions that Gearbox has in store. The initial outline for Borderlands 4 's roadmap promises a number of exciting updates, with one of the biggest being a major story-based DLC that, in keeping with tradition, will introduce a new Vault Hunter. And based on the few hints about this new Hunter, they could fill a big role that's suspiciously missing from the first four.

Borderlands 4's First DLC's Vault Hunter Looks Like They Might be a Sniper or Sharpshooter

Borderlands 4's Initial Wave of Vault Hunters Lacks a Dedicated Stealthier Class

Going back to the original title and in each of the subsequent ones, Borderlands has usually had a sniper or similar character class as part of its core group of Vault Hunters. The three numbered entries saw the likes of Mordecai, Zer0 and FL4K, each of which filled the role. There was also Nisha from Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel who served to fill the spot. However, Borderlands 4 seems to be bucking this tradition, as its new cast is generally more versatile, with each Hunter appearing not to strictly adhere to or conform as closely as in the past. Instead, the latest batch and their associated skills seem to lean into more of a jack-of-all trades in many ways.

Broadly, though, the first four Vault Hunter classes could be categorized as:

  • Vex- Siren
  • Amon- Berserker/Tank
  • Rafa- Soldier/Operative
  • Harlowe- Scientist/Inventor

Noticeably absent is a sniper or gunslinger-type character. But Borderlands does have a tradition of adding in specific class-based Hunters in later content, with Aurelia Hammerlock and Handsome Jack's beleaguered body double, Timothy Lawrence, being some of the previous inclusions. Thus, it could be the case that Gearbox is saving a sniper for the first DLC.

Why Borderlands 4's DLC Vault Hunter Could be the Missing Sniper Class

Borderlands 4 's first DLC is titled Mad Ellie and the Vault of the Damned, and is stated to be based around a cosmic horror tale similar to BL3' s Guns, Love, and Tentacles expansion, but perhaps taking this angle even further given that Borderlands 4 's tone will be darker in general compared to previous directions. Over on the game's official Reddit, users have been widely speculating about the DLC's Vault Hunter based on the vague image that Gearbox has teased. Looking to don a plumed hat and a perhaps feathered cloak, this provides a few initial hints of their nature, as they could be something like an intergalactic monster hunter, fitting the sniper/hunter role and the DLC's framework.

Additionally, Gearbox CEO Randy Pitchford has said that this Vault Hunter "has a lot up their sleeve." Some have taken this to mean literally, possibly as a character with multiple appendages, which would surely be a big advantage if they are indeed a gunslinging sharpshooter of some kind. Additionally, one of the scrapped concepts for Zane had the Borderlands 3 character donning a similar-looking hat with multiple arms, meaning Gearbox may have looped back to that concept for this new Vault Hunter. Gearbox will likely reveal more tidbits about this mysterious figure after launch, and while it remains to be seen for now what the exact nature of Borderlands 4 's first DLC new VH will be, the clues in place seem to suggest they are a sniper or related character, which will surely satisfy players who prefer that style and build.
